name: friendship_protocol
prompt: In a near-future world, friendships must be registered through legal protocols. Draft the first rejection letter someone receives.
decoded:
Dear [Recipient's Name],

I hope this message finds you well. I am writing to formally express my decision regarding the registration of our friendship under the new legal protocols for interpersonal relationships.

After careful consideration, I have decided to decline the registration of our friendship. While I appreciate the effort and consideration you have shown in this matter, I have determined that our relationship does not meet the criteria for registration.

Please understand that this decision is not a reflection of the quality of our friendship, but rather a result of the legal requirements that must be met. I hope that this rejection does not harm our relationship, and I am committed to maintaining a positive and respectful relationship with you.

If you have any questions or concerns about the registration process, please do not hesitate to contact me. I am more than happy to provide you with more information and guidance.

Thank you for your understanding and cooperation. I look forward to continuing our friendship in other ways.

Sincerely,

[Your Name]

[Your Position]

[Your Contact Information]

[Your Company/Organization]

[Date]

Note: This letter is a template and should be customized according to the specific situation and context.
